property.name: text
property.value:
This model models a pendulum on a moving cart. The card moves in x dimension and the pendulum moves in x-z plane.
Pendulum collides with the surface of the cart and bounces back with some energy loss, which is specified by the lambda parameter. There is no extra force except the gravity force applied on the pendulum.
This model is a Zeno model. We use two states for pre-Zeno and post-Zeno dynamics respectively.

property.name: text
property.value: Authors: Aaron D. Ames, Robert D. Gregg, Haiyang Zheng

property.name: text
property.value: There are two non-trivial states. The "state" state specifies the dynamics when the pendulum moves under gravity force while the cart moves. The "constrained" state specifies the dynamics when the pendulum rests on the cart and moves along with the cart. The transition from the "state" state to the "constrained" state is taken when the simulation results are close to the Zeno behavior.

property.name: setActions
